alert.note: Alert for Humboldt County (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 3:27PM PDT by NWS Elko
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Humboldt County through 400 PM PDT... At 326 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles northeast of Golconda, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Heavy rainfall along with gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Twin Creeks Mine and Adam Peak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
